parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Identifier of the room for which the configuration is to be retrieved. Currently this must be an ARN.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: Room ARN, from the request (if identifier was an ARN).

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: Room ID, generated by the system. This is a relative identifier, the part of the ARN that uniquely identifies the room.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: Room name. The value does not need to be unique.

nested_items.name: createTime
nested_items.description: Time when the room was created. This is an ISO 8601 timestamp; note that this is returned as a string.

nested_items.name: updateTime
nested_items.description: Time of the room's last update. This is an ISO 8601 timestamp; note that this is returned as a string.

nested_items.name: maximumMessageRatePerSecond
nested_items.description: Maximum number of messages per second that can be sent to the room (by all clients). Default: 10.

nested_items.name: maximumMessageLength
nested_items.description: Maximum number of characters in a single message. Messages are expected to be UTF-8 encoded and this limit applies specifically to rune/code-point count, not number of bytes. Default: 500.

nested_items.name: messageReviewHandler
nested_items.description: Configuration information for optional review of messages.

nested_items.name: uri
nested_items.description: Identifier of the message review handler. Currently this must be an ARN of a lambda function.

nested_items.name: fallbackResult
nested_items.description: Specifies the fallback behavior (whether the message is allowed or denied) if the handler does not return a valid response, encounters an error, or times out. (For the timeout period, see Service Quotas.) If allowed, the message is delivered with returned content to all users connected to the room. If denied, the message is not delivered to any user. Default: ALLOW.

nested_items.name: loggingConfigurationIdentifiers
nested_items.description: Array of logging configurations attached to the room.
